title: As a boy how can I get into kpop? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, I think gender does not really matter as long as you like something without reprecussions given by others. You could start watching their Music Videos. And from there, switch to variety shows that makes you see their personalities so that you can get to know them better. If you are into dancing videos, you could search their Fancam to appreciate your chosen bias (a person who you stan out of the group you enjoy). Or their dance covers to other artist’s song. This may take days, weeks, or years. But don’t be pressured into going into something just because majority of your peers like something. That being said, being a boy doesn’t mean you shouldn’t like something. You could stream their dance videos all you want and still be an honorable meber of the society. I had a friend who’s into Ateez. He enjoys them so much to the point that he recruited many of his male friends to dance to “Hala Hala” and “Wonderland” just for fun. They were proud that they attracted attention through it, and thus, continued to enjoy Ateez. (His bias is San, by the way. In my friend’s dance team, he said that San inspired him to give his 100% in dancing with facial expressions) So in short, it doesn’t matter if you’re a girl or a boy. Just do what you love. I hope I answered your question, my friend. Have a nice day!

First of all, gender doesn’t matter. You can get into K-pop as a girl, boy, non-binary, etc. Second of all, from what I see, boys tend to prefer girl groups over boy groups. I don’t know why, but maybe it’s because girls are more appealing for boys (maybe not all boys, but a lot that I’ve known). You could check out Red Velvet to begin with. I recommend their happier stuff first like Red Flavor, Umpah Umpah and Happiness first. Later, you can go to their sexier concepts which would be Bad Boy, Psycho and Be Natural.  I also recommend TWICE. Their songs are catchy and fun and the girls are beautiful. Feel Special is a good song to listen to. I also suggest What Is Love, Fancy and Likey.  Finally, I recommend Dreamcatcher. They have a very anime opening vibe and I know that most people (that I’ve met) would prefer anime over K-pop any day. My favourite title track by them has got to be Piri so you should go check that out. They also released their first full album called ”The Tree Of Language: Dystopia”, which is FILLED with bops!  Enjoy the quarantine, Eni <3

I'll first ask what style of music you normally like. For example, most male kpop fans tend to like girl group more than girl groups because…. Well the opposite gender haha, but there is also male fans who prefer the more intense sound of boy groups. If you are the first kind, and you enjoy the cute concept: Twice. If you like a bad girl concept: CLC If you like something different: (g)I-dle If you like Rock music and creepy stuff: Dreamcatcher If you like something mature: Mamamoo If you want 1st Gen: 2ne1 Now… if you prefer boy groups…. If you like the cute concept: TxT If you like meaningful lyrics and powerful MV's: StrayKids If you like an intense powerful sound, rock and electronic music: Monsta X If you like something a bit more elegant but still powerful: Seventeen or SF9 If you want a band: Day6, N.flying If you want an old school band: FTisland If you want 1st Gen kpop: Big Bang, 2pm, MYNAME.

Honestly, it doesn't matter. (You don't have to be romantically attracted to them.) If you're totally new, just head on over to youtube and search up some of those most popular/well-known groups such as Bts, Blackpink, Exo, Twice, etc. or some recently debuted groups like Ateez, Stray Kids, Txt, etc. and take a look at some of those official music videos! If something catches your eye, search up “guide to [group name]” and you get introduced to the lovely personalities of said group. You'll learn about everything- terms, ethics, traditions, media in no time! There are also plenty of wonderful, helpful, and kind people out there that will be more than happy to help you get into their favorite group.

get to know some girl groups maybe? back in primary school i had a lot of male classmates who disliked kpop as they thought that kpop was only for girls and was a very "gay" thing. when i went to secondary school i found out that actually a lot of older boys, teenage boys and even young adults like kpop. for the males they usually stan groups like TWICE who's concepts appeal to them. if you're just starting to get into kpop, it depends on the type of concept you like and the type of group, music you like. some groups are stronger in rap, thus they have more rap parts but some are stronger in vocals and tend to have more vocal parts.
